title.narrative: PUBLIC FINANCES FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: By 2022, selected national and sub-national level authorities have improved capacity to ensure transparent, adequate, efficient and equitable budget allocations in children related social services, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, evidence-driven, integrated and equitable social protection policies, efficient financial allocations and family-friendly local service provision are in place to address the social exclusion of children in Ukraine

related-activity.ref: 4410/A0/05/881 EVIDENCE-DRIVEN, INTEGRATED AND EQUITABLE SOCIAL PROTECTION POLICIES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, selected national and sub-national level authorities have improved capacity to ensure transparent, adequate, efficient andequitable budget allocations in children related social services

description.narrative: UNICEF worked closely with line ministries to maximize the impact of public expenditures on children and to provide sound evidence to ensure that children’s rights are considered as a priority. Budget reviews and costing exercises were commissioned to generate interest and to galvanize decision makers into actions on budgeting for children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022
